items.title: Introduction
items.description: This introductory module provides a comprehensive overview of ethical hacking and cybersecurity fundamentals. Students will learn the basic concepts of hacking, understand the importance of ethical practices in cybersecurity, and gain insights into the role of ethical hackers in today's digital landscape. The module covers essential terminology, the evolution of hacking, and the critical distinction between ethical and malicious hacking.

sections.title: Course Introduction & Overview
sections.desc: Overview of the course structure, learning objectives, and what to expect from the ethical hacking program

sections.title: What is Hacking and Why Do We Learn It?
sections.desc: Understanding the concept of hacking, its history, and the importance of learning ethical hacking in today's digital world

sections.title: Types of Hackers
sections.desc: Exploring different categories of hackers: white hat, black hat, grey hat, and their roles in cybersecurity

sections.title: The Importance of Ethical Hacking
sections.desc: Understanding why ethical hacking is crucial for organizations and how it helps improve security

items.title: Foundations of Ethical Hacking
items.description: This module builds the foundational knowledge necessary for ethical hacking. Students will explore core cybersecurity concepts, common vulnerabilities, and the fundamental principles of information security. The module emphasizes understanding security threats, basic networking concepts, and the methodology used by ethical hackers to identify and address security issues.

sections.title: Understanding Cybersecurity Fundamentals
sections.desc: Learn basic cybersecurity concepts, terminology, and the CIA triad (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability)

sections.title: Vulnerabilities, Threats, and Exploits
sections.desc: Explore common security vulnerabilities, types of threats, and how exploits are used in cyber attacks

sections.title: Ethics and Legal Aspects of Hacking
sections.desc: Understanding legal frameworks, ethical guidelines, and responsibilities of ethical hackers

sections.title: The Hacker's Mindset, Thinking Like an Attacker
sections.desc: Developing the analytical and strategic thinking required for identifying security weaknesses

items.title: Tools and Environments
items.description: This comprehensive module introduces students to the essential tools and environments used in ethical hacking. Students will learn about Kali Linux, the industry-standard penetration testing platform, various security tools, and how to set up safe testing environments. The module includes hands-on practice with common security tools and teaches best practices for using these tools responsibly.

sections.title: Introduction to Hacking Tools
sections.desc: Overview of common tools used in ethical hacking and their specific purposes

sections.title: Overview of Kali Linux and Kali Nethunter
sections.desc: Introduction to Kali Linux distribution and mobile penetration testing with Kali Nethunter

sections.title: Role of Virtual Machines in Ethical Hacking
sections.desc: Setting up and using virtual machines for safe testing environments

sections.title: Common Tools Used by Ethical Hackers
sections.desc: Hands-on practice with essential security tools including Nmap, Wireshark, and Metasploit

items.title: Network Security Basics
items.description: This module delves into the fundamentals of network security, covering essential networking concepts, common vulnerabilities, and attack methodologies. Students will learn about different types of networks, protocols, and how they can be exploited. The module includes practical exercises in network scanning, vulnerability assessment, and understanding network-based attacks.

sections.title: Understanding Networks and Protocols
sections.desc: Deep dive into network architectures, protocols, and how they function

sections.title: Common Network Vulnerabilities
sections.desc: Identifying and understanding various network vulnerabilities and weak points

sections.title: How Cyber Attacks Target Networks
sections.desc: Understanding different types of network-based attacks and their mechanisms

sections.title: Network Security Tools and Techniques
sections.desc: Practical application of tools and methods for securing networks

items.title: Website Security Basics
items.description: This module focuses on web application security, covering common web vulnerabilities, attack vectors, and security best practices. Students will learn about various web security issues including SQL injection, cross-site scripting (XSS), and cross-site request forgery (CSRF). The module includes practical exercises in identifying and exploiting web vulnerabilities, as well as implementing proper security measures.

sections.title: How Websites Work
sections.desc: Understanding web architecture, HTTP/HTTPS protocols, and client-server communication

sections.title: Common Website Vulnerabilities
sections.desc: Exploring OWASP Top 10 and other common web application security risks

sections.title: Steps to Secure a Website
sections.desc: Implementation of security measures and best practices for web applications

sections.title: The Role of Ethical Hackers in Website Security
sections.desc: How ethical hackers help identify and fix web application vulnerabilities

items.title: Social Engineering and Human Vulnerabilities
items.description: This module explores the human aspect of cybersecurity, focusing on social engineering techniques and psychological manipulation used in cyber attacks. Students will learn about various social engineering methods, real-world case studies, and how to protect against these types of attacks. The module emphasizes the importance of human awareness in cybersecurity and provides practical strategies for preventing social engineering attacks.

sections.title: Understanding Social Engineering Attacks
sections.desc: Introduction to social engineering concepts and common attack techniques

sections.title: Psychological Tactics Used by Hackers
sections.desc: Exploring the psychology behind social engineering and manipulation techniques

sections.title: Case Studies of Famous Social Engineering Attacks
sections.desc: Analysis of real-world social engineering incidents and their impact

sections.title: How to Prevent Social Engineering Attacks
sections.desc: Strategies and best practices for protecting against social engineering

items.title: Ethical Hacking in Practice
items.description: This advanced module puts theoretical knowledge into practice through hands-on exercises and real-world scenarios. Students will learn the complete ethical hacking methodology, from initial reconnaissance to final reporting. The module covers penetration testing procedures, documentation requirements, and best practices for conducting security assessments. Students will gain practical experience in identifying vulnerabilities, executing controlled exploits, and providing professional security recommendations.

sections.title: Steps in an Ethical Hacking Process
sections.desc: Detailed walkthrough of the ethical hacking methodology and phases

sections.title: Understanding Penetration Testing
sections.desc: Comprehensive guide to conducting professional penetration tests

sections.title: Importance of Reporting and Documentation
sections.desc: Learning how to document findings and create professional security reports

sections.title: How Ethical Hacking Helps Organizations
sections.desc: Understanding the business value of ethical hacking and security assessments

items.title: Emerging Trends in Cybersecurity
items.description: This forward-looking module explores current and emerging trends in cybersecurity and ethical hacking. Students will learn about cutting-edge technologies, evolving threat landscapes, and future career opportunities in cybersecurity. The module covers the impact of artificial intelligence, IoT security challenges, and the changing nature of cyber threats, preparing students for the future of cybersecurity.

sections.title: The Role of AI and Machine Learning in Hacking and Defense
sections.desc: Understanding how AI and ML are transforming both cyber attacks and defense

sections.title: Cybersecurity Challenges in IoT (Internet of Things)
sections.desc: Exploring security implications and challenges in the growing IoT landscape

sections.title: The Future of Ethical Hacking
sections.desc: Examining upcoming trends and evolution in ethical hacking practices

sections.title: Careers in Cybersecurity and Ethical Hacking
sections.desc: Overview of career paths, certifications, and opportunities in cybersecurity

items.title: Cyber Security Basics
items.summary: A beginner-friendly video covering the basics of cyber security.

items.title: Protecting Your Digital Identity
items.summary: Learn how to safeguard your online identity.

items.title: How to Spot a Phishing Email
items.summary: Tips and tricks for identifying phishing emails.

items.title: The Rise of Ransomware
items.summary: An overview of ransomware and its impact on businesses.

items.title: Top Cybersecurity Tools
items.summary: A guide to essential cybersecurity tools.

items.title: What is Multi-Factor Authentication?
items.summary: Learn about MFA and its importance in securing accounts.

items.title: Cybersecurity Trends in 2024
items.summary: An analysis of the latest trends in cybersecurity.

items.title: Cybersecurity for Remote Workers
items.summary: Best practices for maintaining security while working remotely.

items.title: Understanding Social Engineering
items.summary: A look at how social engineering attacks work.

items.title: Building a Cybersecurity Career
items.summary: Tips for starting a career in cybersecurity.
